what: Lightweight R Interface to Igraph Network Analysis Library
title: Lightweight R Interface to Igraph Network Analysis Library
text: igraphlite cpp11-powered R package interface igraph network analysis library. fork existing R igraph package, reboot scratch striving good performance, simple codebase, consistency C implementation.

title: Lightweight R Interface to Igraph Network Analysis Library
text: Unix-like environment (macOS, Linux, WSL, MinGW MSYS2, etc.) C++17 compiler (clang++ >= Apple clang 11.0, g++ >= 9.1) CMake GLPK libxml2 R igraph package C igraph library: igraphlite can use existing igraph library faster installation built IGRAPH_INTEGER_SIZE=32 found CMake find_package(). example, brew install heavywatal/tap/igraph32 provides library. Environment variables ${igraph_ROOT} ${CMAKE_PREFIX_PATH} can used help CMake find . found, appropriate version built installed automatically. macOS: Ubuntu:
code: brew install cmake glpk sudo apt install build-essential cmake libglpk-dev libxml2-dev

title: Lightweight R Interface to Igraph Network Analysis Library
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("heavywatal/rigraphlite")

Ignored undirected graphs. error logical value, whether raise error assign 0 non-existing edges. integer vector vertex IDs. integer vector vertex IDs. vid integer value vertex ID. mode integer value edge type count; {1: , 2: , 3: }. loops whether self-loop counted. multiple logical value, whether keep multiple (parallel) edges. vids integer vector vertex IDs.

title: Basic query operations to get adjacency — basic-adjacent
text: edge() edges() return head tail vertices edges. get_eids() returns edge IDs given vertex pairs. get_all_eids_between() returns edge IDs two vertices. neighbors() returns adjacent vertices vertex. incident() returns incident edges vertex. degree() returns degrees vertices graph.

title: Centrality measures — centrality
text: graph igraph_ptr object. vids integer vector vertex IDs. mode integer value edge type count; {1: , 2: , 3: }. weights numeric vector edge weights; TRUE use Eattr(graph, "weight"). normalized logical value, whether normalize result. ... Unused, temporarily included avoid silent bugs prompt users cope breaking changes version 1.0. integer vector vertex IDs. integer vector vertex IDs. directed logical value, whether consider directed paths. Ignored undirected graphs. cutoff Maximum length paths considered. Unlimited negative. eids integer vector edge IDs. reset numeric vector probabilities vertex reset point. empty, uniform probabilities assumed. damping numeric value 0 1, damping factor. Walking restarts random vertex probability 1 - damping. loops integer value, treat loop edges; {0: NO_LOOPS, 1: LOOPS/LOOPS_TWICE, 2: LOOPS_ONCE}

title: Centrality measures — centrality
text: closeness() returns inverse mean distance vertices. harmonic_centrality() returns mean inverse distance vertices. betweenness() returns numeric vector betweenness vertex graph. edge_betweenness() returns numeric vector edge betweenness edge graph. edge_betweenness_subset() variant edge_betweenness() computes betweenness using subset paths . pagerank() returns numeric vector PageRank scores vertex. constraint() returns numeric vector Burt's constraint scores. maxdegree() equivalent max(degree(graph)). strength() vertex sum weights incident edges. eigenvector_centrality() vertex proportional sum eigenvector centralities neighbors. hub_and_authority_scores() generalization ideas behind eigenvector centrality directed graphs. convergence_degree() returns normalized value difference size input set output set.

title: Degree-constrained models — degree_sequence_game
text: https://igraph.org/c/html/latest/igraph-Games.html#degree-constrained-games

title: Degree-constrained models — degree_sequence_game
text: out_degrees, in_degrees Integer vectors giving degree sequences. Undirected graphs generated empty in_degrees given. degseq_method method generate graph degree sequence: {0: smallest, 1: largest, 2: index}. n number vertices. k degree vertex undirected graph, -degree -degree vertex directed graph. directed logical value, whether consider directed paths. Ignored undirected graphs. multiple logical value, whether keep multiple (parallel) edges. graph igraph_ptr object. n_trials number rewiring trials perform. edge_type_sw types edges allow graph: {0: simple, 1: loops, 6: multiple, 7: loops multiple}.

title: Degree-constrained models — degree_sequence_game
text: igraph_ptr object.

title: Degree-constrained models — degree_sequence_game
code: out_deg = seq_len(4L) undirected = degree_sequence_game(out_deg) degree(undirected) #> [1] 1 2 3 4  in_deg = rev(out_deg) directed = degree_sequence_game(out_deg, in_deg) degree(directed, mode = 1L) #> [1] 1 2 3 4 degree(directed, mode = 2L) #> [1] 4 3 2 1  k_regular = k_regular_game(7L, 2L) degree(k_regular) #> [1] 2 2 2 2 2 2 2 degree(rewire(k_regular, 9L)) #> [1] 2 2 2 2 2 2 2

title: Permute the vertices — permutation
text: https://igraph.org/c/html/latest/igraph-Isomorphism.html#igraph_permute_vertices

title: Permute the vertices — permutation
text: graph igraph_ptr object. colors optional vertex color vector integer. permutation integer vector, whose -th element specifies index vertex original graph become vertex new graph.

title: Permute the vertices — permutation
text: canonical_permutation() returns integer vector. permutate_vertices() returns igraph_ptr object isomorphic input graph.

title: Permute the vertices — permutation
code: g1 = graph_create(c(1L, 2L, 1L, 3L), directed = FALSE) g2 = graph_create(c(3L, 2L, 3L, 1L), directed = FALSE) isomorphic(g1, g2) #> [1] TRUE is_same_graph(g1, g2) #> [1] FALSE # as.matrix(g1) and as.matrix(g2) may differ  g1can = permutate_vertices(g1, canonical_permutation(g1)) g2can = permutate_vertices(g2, canonical_permutation(g2)) is_same_graph(g1can, g2can) #> [1] TRUE  isomorphic(g1, permutate_vertices(g1, c(3L, 2L, 1L))) #> [1] TRUE
